page.title: 07The Hebden Bridge Times
page.content: The{Hebden Bridge Times}was first printed in 1843. Its cost was 1.5d (old pennies). Its cost now is 16p which is nearly 13 times as much. About 4000 papers are printed each week and about 3800 are sold. On average each week about 45 % of the paper is news and about 55 % is adverts. All together there are 4 full time reporters and two part time, four full time and two part time advertisment staff, and some free lance photographers. The area for collecting news is from{Charlestown}to {Luddenden Foot.}But the area for selling is from{Todmorden}to {Halifax.}Anyone can order the paper anywhere if they want to know about the district. The lead story (June 7 85) was the danger of a local church closing.News is collected by reporters who go to local events and meetings.
